item.title: 日本股市暴跌，领跌全球股市：市场综述
item.description: 周一，由于对美联储将推迟对美国经济放缓采取行动的担忧加剧，股市下挫加剧。日本股市连续第三天暴跌，原因是交易商预计日本国内将进一步加息。【原文：A stocks selloff worsened on Monday as concerns grew that the Federal Reserve will delay acting on a slowing US economy. Japanese shares plunged for a third day as traders priced in more domestic rate hikes.】

item.title: 日本 Topix 和 Nikkei 股价指数从七月峰值下跌 20
item.description: 日元飙升、利率上调和中东地缘政治紧张局势使本已脆弱的全球投资者信心雪上加霜，日本股市连续第三天下跌。【原文：Japan’s equity rout entered a third day as weak US jobs data added another blow to global investor confidence that is already fragile from the surge in the yen, higher interest rates and geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 比索下挫，日元飙升，全球套利交易平仓期延长
item.description: 日元周一走高，而墨西哥比索的跌势则因交易员继续平仓新兴市场套利交易而延续。【原文：The yen pushed higher Monday, while the Mexican peso’s slump extended as traders continued to unwind emerging market carry trades.】

item.title: 比特币跌破 59,000 美元，创下自 FTX 崩溃以来最糟糕的一周
item.description: 比特币正受到全球市场避险情绪的冲击，使这一最大的数字资产遭受了自2022年FTX交易所倒闭以来最严重的单周损失。【原文：Bitcoin is under pressure from a bout of risk aversion in global markets that saddled the largest digital asset with its heftiest weekly loss since the collapse of the FTX exchange in 2022.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 中国推出 20 项刺激消费措施巴菲特减持苹果公司股份亚洲股市将下跌。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：China unveils 20 measures to boost spending. Buffett slashes stake in Apple. Asian stocks are set to drop. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 以色列准备发动攻击，石油从七个月低点回升
item.description: 在预期伊朗将对以色列发动袭击之前，中东紧张局势加剧，石油从七个月低点回升。【原文：Oil rose from a seven-month low as tensions in the Middle East intensified ahead of an anticipated strike on Israel by Iran.】

item.title: 对经济和战争的担忧加深，股市注定下跌
item.description: 亚洲市场周一将出现下跌，因为对经济进一步放缓的担忧令交易商感到不安，他们还在为中东紧张局势加剧带来的更大波动做准备。【原文：Asian markets are poised for losses on Monday as fears of a deeper economic slowdown unnerve traders also bracing for more volatility from rising tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 被视为全球工业健康风向标的重型机械制造商卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.中国正在加大小麦采购力度，铜投资者正在分析基金经理发出的信号，以了解他们对这一重要工业金属的看法。【原文：Caterpillar Inc., the heavy machinery maker that’s seen as a bellwether for the health of global industry, reports second-quarter earnings this week. China is ramping up wheat purchases, and copper investors are parsing signals from money managers for their outlook on the key industrial metal.】

item.title: 经济停滞不前，德国首席财务官面临 "霉变 "问题
item.description:
另外，海德堡公司的财务总监管理着一个棘手的转机。【原文：

Plus, Heidelberger Druck’s finance chief manages a tricky turnaround. 

】

item.title: 路透社称士力架生产商玛氏正寻求收购凯兰诺华
item.description: 据路透社报道，糖果巨头玛氏公司（Mars Inc.【原文：Candy giant Mars Inc. is exploring the acquisition of Kellanova in what would be one of the biggest deals ever in the packaged food sector, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯上调亚洲油价，表明对需求的信心
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯三个月来首次提高了对亚洲的旗舰原油价格，这表明沙特对世界最大进口国的需求仍然充满信心。【原文：Saudi Arabia raised the price of its flagship crude to Asia for the first time in three months, a sign that the kingdom remains confident about demand in the world’s largest importer.】

item.title: 债券交易员豪赌美联储启动救援模式
item.description: 债券交易员们纷纷押注美国经济即将迅速放缓，以至于美联储需要开始积极放宽货币政策，以避免经济衰退。【原文：Bond traders are piling into bets that the US economy is on the verge of slowing so quickly that the Federal Reserve will need to start easing monetary policy aggressively to head off a recession.】

item.title: RBA Set for Hawkish Hold, Trailing Global Peers in Easing Cycle
item.description: 澳大利亚将继续处于全球宽松周期的末端，因为当地通胀虽然在降温，但仍然居高不下，这要求储备银行将其关键利率维持在12年来的高位。【原文：Australia is poised to stay near the back of the global easing cycle as local inflation — while cooling — remains elevated requiring the Reserve Bank to keep its key interest rate at a 12-year high.】

item.title: 高盛经济学家将美国经济衰退风险 "有限 "上调至 25
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. economists increased the probability of a US recession in the next year to 25% from 10%, but said there are several reasons not to fear a slump even after unemployment jumped.】

item.title: 巴菲特减持苹果股份后，苹果投资者被敦促保持冷静
item.description: 在一些人看来，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.但华尔街的许多人都敦促投资者看淡这一消息，保持冷静。【原文：To some, Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s gutting of its Apple Inc. stake could be interpreted as a lack of conviction in the iPhone maker’s growth story. But many on Wall Street are urging investors to look past the news and stay calm.】

item.title: 情绪转好，加密货币在纽约再次蓬勃发展
item.description: 加密初创公司 Concrete 最近从旧金山湾区迁往纽约肉类加工区，这可能是大苹果地区数字资产复兴萌芽的象征。【原文：Crypto startup Concrete recent decamping to New York’s Meatpacking District from the San Francisco Bay Area may be emblematic of a budding digital-asset renaissance in the Big Apple.】

item.title: 股市正在旋转。问题在于下一步走向
item.description: 上周，由于担心美联储错失帮助摇摇欲坠的美国经济的良机而引发的股市剧烈下挫结束了一次轮动交易，也可能开启了另一次轮动交易，这让投资者猜测股市何去何从。【原文：The violent stock market selloff last week triggered by fears that the Federal Reserve missed its chance to help a faltering US economy ended one rotation trade and may have started another, leaving investors guessing where equities go from here.】

item.title: 高盛和富达对新兴市场债券的美元走势产生分歧
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.富达国际则持相反观点。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. says emerging-market investors should favor dollar-denominated bonds over local-currency ones. Fidelity International says the opposite.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀率将大幅下降，央行可能不予理睬
item.description: 土耳其的总体通胀率在 7 月份可能出现了近两年来的最大降幅，这一放缓主要是由于基数效应造成的，而官员们在关注价格面临的更直接风险时可能会忽略这一点。【原文：Turkey’s headline inflation likely saw the sharpest drop in nearly two years in July, a slowdown largely due to base effects that officials may overlook as they focus on more immediate risks to prices.】

item.title: 以色列股市因全球市场下跌和伊朗威胁而暴跌
item.description: 以色列股市周日大幅下跌，赶上了世界市场的疲软，反映出伊朗及其地区代理人的持续攻击威胁。【原文：Israeli shares fell sharply on Sunday, catching up with weakness in world markets and reflecting the continued threat of attacks from Iran and its regional proxies.】

item.title: 孟加拉国下令关闭移动互联网以平息抗议活动
item.description: 孟加拉国电信局在三周内第二次下令关闭 4G 移动互联网服务，以平息致命的抗议活动。【原文：Bangladesh’s telecom authority ordered a shutdown of 4G mobile Internet services for the second time in three weeks to quell deadly protests.】

item.title: 卫星图像显示俄罗斯受制裁工厂的首艘液化天然气船
item.description: A large vessel docked at Russia’s liquefied natural gas export plant in the Arctic at the end of last week, according to satellite images, in what appears to be the first move to circumvent US sanctions against the facility.

item.title: Euro Zone’s Big Growth Laggard Has a Lot of Cheery Consumers
item.description: 欧元区一些最乐观的消费者就出现在该地区最不景气的经济体德国。【原文：Some of the euro zone’s most upbeat consumers can be found in one of the region’s most sickly economies — Germany.】

item.title: 利比亚据说将开始部分关闭最大油田
item.description: 利比亚最大的油田开始部分停产，三位直接了解情况的人士说。【原文：Libya started a partial production shutdown of its largest oil field, three people with direct knowledge of the operations said.】

item.title: 东海岸和海湾地区码头工人将于下月就罢工计划举行会议
item.description: 就在总统大选前几周，一场将导致美国 10 个最繁忙港口中的 6 个关闭的罢工正变得越来越有可能。【原文：A labor strike that would shut down six out of 10 of the busiest ports in the US just weeks before the presidential election is looking increasingly likely.】

item.title: 加息重创日本，投资者着眼长远
item.description: 日本上周的加息对基准指数的打击是八年来最大的。尽管局势动荡，一些投资者仍对日本股市的长期前景充满信心。【原文：This past week’s rate hike in Japan hammered the benchmark index the most in eight years. Despite the turmoil, some investors still have faith in the long-term outlook for the country’s stocks.】

item.title: Apax 支持的周转箱供应商 Tosca 正在与贷款人谈判现金事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿帕克斯合伙公司（Apax Partners）支持的托斯卡服务有限责任公司（Tosca Services LLC）正在与一些债权人商讨新贷款事宜，以增加公司的现金流。【原文：Apax Partners-backed Tosca Services LLC is holding discussions with some creditors for a new loan that would give the company a cash boost, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国经济仅靠一个引擎继续滑行
item.description: 中国经济今年的持续增长有赖于工业生产，而未来一周的数据将提供线索，说明这种支持的力度有多大。【原文：China’s economy has leaned on industrial production to keep growing this year, and data in the coming week will provide clues on how strong that support remains.】

item.title: 巴西卢拉批准绿色氢能法案，否决税收减免政策
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）批准了建立低碳氢法律框架的立法，但否决了给予某些税收减免的措辞。【原文：Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva approved legislation establishing a legal framework for low-carbon hydrogen, but vetoed language that would have granted certain tax credits.】

item.title: 信贷交易员急于为美国经济担忧套期保值
item.description: 随着人们对美国经济和欧洲消费者健康状况的担忧加剧，债务投资者正在加码购买企业债券违约保险。【原文：Debt investors are loading up on insurance against corporate bond defaults as concerns mount about the health of the US economy and the European consumer.】
